issues.description:
Imported from https://bitbucket.org/kevindunn/quest/issues/76/mcq-templates-are-fragile 

 [[type]]
multi
[[attribs]]
Contributor: Kevin Dunn
Difficulty: 2
Tags: least squares, linear model
Grade: 2
[[question]]
Check all options that *correctly apply*:

A least squares model, \(y_i = b_0 + b_1 x_i + e_i\), shows signs of non-constant error variance:

--
& The model coefficients \(b_0\) and \(b_1\) will not be calculated correctly.
^ Confidence intervals for \(\beta_0\) and \(\beta_1\) will be wider than they would otherwise be.
^ The problem may be reduced by using weighted least squares instead.
^ The problem is detected when plotting the residuals against the predicted \(y\)-values.
& Is problematic, because it means the residuals are not normally distributed.
[[Solution]]
The above works


[[type]]
multi
[[attribs]]
Contributor: Kevin Dunn
Difficulty: 2
Tags: least squares, linear model
Grade: 2
[[question]]
Check all options that *correctly apply*:

A least squares model, \(y_i = b_0 + b_1 x_i + e_i\), shows signs of non-constant error variance:

--
& The model coefficients \(b_0\) and \(b_1\) will not be calculated correctly.
^ Confidence intervals for \(\beta_0\) and \(\beta_1\) will be wider than they would otherwise be.
^ The problem may be reduced by using weighted least squares instead.
^ The problem is detected when plotting the residuals against the predicted \(y\)-values.
& Is problematic, because it means the residuals are not normally distributed.

[[Solution]]
Leaving an extra line above Solution causes bad checkbox placement

Imported from https://bitbucket.org/kevindunn/quest/issues/87/do-not-allow-precision-of-0-in-quick_eval 

 e.g. you might be tempted to specify an integer as

 ["[{% quick_eval \"0.001035003*N\" 0 %},1E-6,'rel']"]

but the correct rounding for an integer is

 ["[{% quick_eval \"0.001035003*N\" 1 %},1E-6,'rel']"]
issues.summary: Do not allow precision of "0" in quick_eval

issues.description:
Imported from https://bitbucket.org/kevindunn/quest/issues/53/comment-out-wing-debug 

 I use this one in my Django settings for every project
  DEBUG = bool(int(os.environ.get('DJANGO_DEBUG', 0)))
and all my working environment define DJANGO_DEBUG=1.  This means things
like runserver/shell (any management command) runs in debug mode, but
production runs automatically default to DEBUG=False

For wingdbstub, you can something like this:

if os.environ["WING_DEBUG"]
  import wingdbstub
endif

issues.description:
Imported from https://bitbucket.org/kevindunn/quest/issues/34/sort-out-the-mess-between-timing-and-token 

 * what's the difference
* what happens when Token or Timing is invalid / used up?
* How to ensure users can see the solutions to previous Quiz sets when working on a subsequent quiz set

comments.body:
Fixed. Tokens are for authentication.

Timing Objects are used to help decide authorization on what can be done (answering questions, seeing solutions, etc)
comments.author: 557058:75d9630a-689f-4e0e-a6dd-6368bb668f02

issues.summary: Sort out the mess between Timing and Token objects

comments.body: Not been an issue that I'm aware of.
